translated: Jātaka🔽The Group of Three Collections🔽The Chapter on Thoughts
“I have abundant and excellent food and drink,
Which arises because of this jewel;
I will not give it to you, as you are asking too much,

analyzed: na ca api te assamam āgamissa
translated: And I will not come to your hermitage.
Like a well-bred dog with a stone in its mouth,
You frighten me by asking for the jewel;
I will not give it to you, as you are asking too much,

analyzed: na ca api te assamam āgamissa
translated: And I will not come to your hermitage.”

analyzed: na tam yāce yassa piyam jigīse
translated: “I do not ask for what you hold dear,
For one is despised by asking too much;
The elephant, asked for the jewel by the brahmin,

analyzed: a dassanayā iva tat ajjhagamāti 🔽maṇikaṇṭha jātakam tatiya
translated: Simply disappeared.”🔽The Jewel-Neck Jātaka is the third.
